title: Sad photo shows new dad leave hospital with 'ghost' of wife killed by childbirth
text:
Scott Jenkins shared a tear-jerking photo of himself posing next to wife Aly – who died in childbirth – and his new baby daughter Sydney as he left hospital without his late wife (Pictures: Scott Jenkins/GoFundMe)

A newly-widowed father has shared a heartbreaking photoshopped picture of himself leaving hospital with his ‘guardian angel’ wife who died after giving birth.

Scott Jenkins posted the snap of him carrying his newborn daughter Sydney Alyssa out of hospital Tuesday, with wife Aly apparently by his side.

But a closer look reveals that Aly – a professional curler from Saskatchewan in Canada – has been photoshopped in, after the curler was killed on October 25.

She suffered a fatal embolism – blocked blood vessel – after amniotic fluid entered her bloodstream while giving birth to her third child.

Baby Sydney was left critically ill following her mother’s illness and death, but thankfully pulled through and is now home with her dad and siblings.

Sharing the photo on Facebook, Scott wrote: ‘Today I left the hospital with our little miracle and our guardian angel

‘ I can’t thank everyone enough for all the support we have received this last week!

‘I want to thank every single doctor and nurse who tried to save alys life and the ones who gave Sydney life after being in critical condition to out of hospital in 9 days!!!’

Scott added: ‘I know Aly is working her magic from above to help little Sydney Alyssa Jenkins and all our family and friends!

‘I am going to miss you so much Aly! Until we meet again babe I love you.’

Aly was a much-loved member of her local Sherry Anderson’s Saskatchewan curling team, with her death prompting a flood of tributes.

She and Scott are also parents to a four year-old boy and 18 month-old girl.

A GoFundMe page set up to support Aly’s loved ones has already raised more than $150,000.
description: Scott Jenkins shared a tear-jerking photo of him with late wife Aly apparently by his side as he left the hospital with their new baby daughter
